metadata.title: gstreamer1-plugins-good: uninitialized stack memory in Matroska/WebM demuxer (important)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: The CVE program describes this issue as: GStreamer is a library for constructing graphs of media-handling components. An uninitialized stack variable vulnerability has been identified in the gst_matroska_demux_add_wvpk_header function within matroska-demux.c. When size < 4, the program calls gst_buffer_unmap with an uninitialized map variable. Then, in the gst_memory_unmap function, the program will attempt to unmap the buffer using the uninitialized map variable, causing a function pointer hijack, as it will jump to mem->allocator->mem_unmap_full or mem->allocator->mem_unmap. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to hijack the execution flow, potentially leading to code execution. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.24.10.

criterions.comment: gstreamer1-plugins-good-gtk is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
gstreamer1-plugins-good is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
